sidebar.components.embarazoPadrePsicolog: Changes in sleep pattern, symptoms of anxiety, irritability, decreased libido and restlessness.
sidebar.components.embarazoPadreFisicos: Nausea, feeling of swelling, changes in appetite, 'cravings', weight gain, headache, leg cramps, back pain, and urinary or genital discomfort.
sidebar.components.embarazoPadre: Couvade syndrome: When parents develop the symptoms of pregnancy
sidebar.components.listaFarmacos4: May cause a characteristic fetal malformation, cleft palate.
sidebar.components.listaFarmacos3: Associated with malformations of the trachea, esophagus, heart and anus in the fetus
sidebar.components.listaFarmacos2: can cause hypoglycemia sustained over time.
sidebar.components.listaFarmacos1: Related to birth defects in the fetus.
sidebar.components.listaFarmacos0: They alter the blood flow of the fetus.
sidebar.components.farmacos: Drugs that should not be taken during pregnancy
sidebar.components.razonAcidoFolico: Pregnant women should consume at least 0.4 milligrams of folic acid daily for three months after becoming pregnant. Studies show that this significantly reduces the risk of a baby having neural tube defects.
sidebar.components.acidoFolico: Reasons why a pregnant woman should take folic acid
